title: Introduction to Human Communication and Speech-language-hearing Sciences
requirements: For students in PgD Communication Disorders & Sciences
description: Human communication will be introduced from the perspective of a chain of communication processes from concept formation to message received. This course gives an overview of the basic concepts and terms associated with speech, language and hearing disorders.

title: Applied Assessment and Therapeutic Skills I
requirements: For students in PgD Communication Disorders & Sciences
description: This course is designed to teach students to integrate theories into clinical practice. Practical skills will be taught and students are required to have guided observation on clients with various communication disorders under close supervision. Students are required to be proficient either in Cantonese or Mandarin.

description: This course is designed to teach students to integrate theories into clinical practice. title: Acquired Neurogenic Communication Disorders in Adults
requirements: For students in PgD Communication Disorders & Sciences
description: The course focuses on speech and language disorders resulting from cardiovascular and cerebrovascular damage due to trauma, disease and adventitious central nervous system (CNS) events. Evaluation and management of the related language, speech and cognitive disorders will be covered.

title: Special Topics in Speech and Language Disorders
requirements: For students in PgD Communication Disorders & Sciences
description: This course will focus on specific topics in speech and language disorders that are not covered in the regular course offering. These topics will reflect academic needs/interests and faculty expertise. Students are allowed to take this course more than once, and gain the units each time they pass the course. However, students cannot take the course under the same topic twice.

title: Case Studies
requirements: For students in PgD Communication Disorders & Sciences
description: This is an independent, individual investigation on a specific case or a case series with communication or swallowing disorders guided by a supervisor. Students have to submit a comprehensive case report for assessment.

title: Research Project
requirements: For students in PgD Communication Disorders & Sciences
description: This is an independent, individual investigation on a topic in communication sciences and disorders guided by a supervisor. Students have to submit a comprehensive research report for assessment.
